intro: Hydrangea serrata var. stellata, commonly known as the star hydrangea, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It is characterized by its unique, cone-shaped flower clusters that bloom in late spring to early summer. The flowers are typically white or pink, and they gradually change color depending on soil pH. The plant has serrated leaves that are dark green with a slightly rough texture. It thrives in partial shade and moist, well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens.
